properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 10:28PM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...

.A winter storm is expected to impact the region this evening
through Thursday, with widespread heavy mountain snow
accumulations likely. Snow levels will range from 2000 to
3000 feet by Thursday morning, which will cause heavy snow to
accumulate across interior mountain highways, including Highways
299, 199, 36, and 3. In addition, accumulating small hail will be
possible across coastal areas late Wednesday night into Thursday.

* WHAT...Snow expected above 2500 feet. 2 to 6 inches inches of
snow expected with snow levels falling to 2500 feet tonight.
Gusty south winds at the onset of the snow will diminish
quickly overnight.

* WHERE...Interior portions of Northern Mendocino County.

* WHEN...Through 4 PM PST Thursday. Heaviest snow will be
overnight into Thursday morning.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET
